did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: This collection consists of various collectibles from the ILGWU, such as badges, buttons, ball-point pens, tie tacks, money clips, newspaper articles, plaques, photos, scarf, t-shirt, books, banners and more.
did.langmaterial: Collection material in Chinese, English, Spanish, Yiddish

bioghist.head: ILGWU ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: The International Ladies' Garment Workers' Union was once one of the largest labor unions in the United States founded in 1900 by local union delegates representing about 2,000 members in cities in the northeastern United States. It was one of the first U.S. Unions to have a membership consisting of mostly females, and it played a key role in the labor history of the 1920s and 1930s. The union is generally referred to as the "ILGWU" or the "ILG". The ILGWU grew in geographical scope, membership size, and political influence to become one of the most powerful forces in American organized labor by mid-century. Representing workers in the women's garment industry, the ILGWU worked to improve working and living conditions of its members through collective bargaining agreements, training programs, health care facilities, cooperative housing, educational opportunities, and other efforts. The ILGWU merged with the Amalgamated Clothing and Textile Workers Union in 1995 to form the Union of Needle trades, Industrial and Textile Employees (UNITE). UNITE merged with the Hotel Employees and Restaurant Employees Union (HERE) in 2004 to create a new union known as UNITE HERE. The two unions that formed UNITE in 1995 represented only 250,000 workers between them, down from the ILGWU's peak membership of 450,000 in 1969.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of various collectibles from the ILGWU, such as badges, buttons, ball-point pens, tie tacks, money clips, newspaper articles, plaques, photos, scarf, t-shirt, books, banners and more.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

did.unittitle: International Ladies' Garment Workers' Union - Badges

scopecontent.p: Badges with pendants - 'Honor Guest' (yellow) ; 'Vice President' (green) ; 'Delegate' (blue) ; 'Genl. Sec-Treas' (white) ; 'President' (white) ; 'Exec. Vice Pres' (red) ; 'Press' (orange) ; 'Sgt At Arms' (red/white/blue) ; 'Staff' (white) ; Pendants have writing "Thirty-Eighth Convention, Hollywood, Fla., May 27, 1983"

International Ladies' Garment Workers' Union - Badges (Dupl)
International Ladies' Garment Workers' Union - Badges, buttons, push-pins, sewing kits, pens

scopecontent.p: Badges - ILGWU - "Guest" for 34th, & 38th Conventions ; "Vice President" for 38th ; "Delegate" for 36th ; "Genl. Sec-Treas" for 38th

did.unittitle: International Ladies' Garment Workers' Union - Badges

scopecontent.p: Badges - ILGWU - "Delegate" for 25th (Boston, Mass. 1944), 29th (Atlantic City 1956), 34th (Miami Beach 1971), 35th (Miami Beach 1974), 37th (New York 1980) ; "Guest" for 32nd (Miami 1965), 34th (Miami 1971), 35th (Miami 1974), 37th (New York 1980) ; "First Vice Pres." & "Gen. Secy. Treas." for 33rd (Atlantic City 1968)

did.unittitle: International Ladies' Garment Workers' Union & AFL-CIO - Badges

scopecontent.p: Badges - ILGWU - "Delegate" for 34th (Miami Beach 1971), 37th (New York 1980 ; "Guest" for 35th (Miami 1974), 37th (New York 1980), AFL-CIO - "Guest" for 5th biennial (New York 1963), 71st (New York 1962), 15th biennial (Hollywood, Fla 1963), 4th biennial (Miami 1961)

scopecontent.p: Buttons - "Israel Histadrut, National Convention1950" ; "New York Convention Center, 1984" ; "International Ladies' Garbment Workers' Union, 38th Convention1983" ; badges - "Guest" of 90th Annual Convention, New York State Federation of Labor1953" ; "Delegate" for 8th Annual Convention, New York1946" ; "Delegate" for N.J. State Federation of Labor1954"
Buttons - "ILGWU, AFL-CIO, International Ladies' Garment Workers' Union, Organized 1900"

Buttons - "Contratto 88" ; "Contract 88" ; "Local 23-25 ILGWU" ; "Local 23-25, Committee to Defend the Union Contract, ILGWU", "Local 23-25, ILGWU, Shop Representative" ; "Save Our Jobs, ILGWU, Veto the Veto"

Buttons - "Solidarity, American Movement" ; "Keep New York a Union Town" ; "Liberty & Union, ILGWU" ; "I Am An Active Retiree, "International Ladies'" ; "Created with Pride in U.S.A." ; "Forward with Lewis and CIO" ; "10th Anniversary. Antiguq Workers Union" ; "ILGWU, Women's Health Brigade, 1942" ; "Union Defenders Committee..." ; "Look for our Label... We'll Look for Yours!"

Badges - "Press", "Honor Guest" for 29th Convention (Atlantic City) ; "Sergeant. At Arms", "Honor Guest" , "Delegate" for 30th Convention (Miami Beach) ; "Delegate" for 31st Convention (Atlantic City) ; "Delegate", "Staff", "Guest", "Delegate" for 32nd Convention (Miami Beach) of the ILGWU, AFL-CIO.

Badges - "Guest", "President" for 33rd Convention (Atlantic City) ; "Guest", "Executive Pres.", "Delegate" for the 36th Convention (Hollywood, Fla.) ; "Guest" for 37th Convention (New York) ; "Exec. Vice Pres.", "Guest" for 38th Convention (Hollywood, Fla) of the ILGWU, AFL-CIO, CLC.

Badges - "Delegate", "Secretary", "Guest" for 25th Convention (Boston, Mass) of the ILGWU. "Committee" of the 23rd Convention (Atlantic City), "Delegate" of the 63rd Convention, New Jersey, State Federation of Labor, Atlantic City, New Jersey1940"
Buttons - "Bill Clinton for President, ILGWU" ; "McGovern" ; "Humphrey/Muskie" ; "Roosevelt, ILGWU" ; "Register Vote Nov. 2" ; "Harriman" ; "Carter/Mondale, ILGWU" ; "We Want "CHICK""
Badges with bronze pendants - "Guest", "Delegate", "Sergeant. At Arms" for 26th Convention, Cleveland, 1947, "International Ladies' Garment Workers' Union"
Badges - "Guest" for 23rd Convention, Atlantic City, 1937" ; "Delegate", "Staff", "Guest" for 40th Anniversary Convention, New York" (pendants shaped like thread spools)

Badges - "Guest" for 1st Convention , New York City1955" ; 2nd, 3rd, 5th Biennial Conventions, "Guest" & "Delegate", badges are gold and silver in color with an "AFL-CIO" pendant hanging from the bottom. Each badge has a raised picture of the city in which the convention was held.

Badges - "Guest" & "Delegate" for the 6th Biennial Convention1965" (San Francisco, Calif) ; "Delegate" for the 7th1967" (Bal Harbour, Fla) ; "Delegate" for the 13th & 16th1979 & 1985" (Washington, DC, Anaheim, Calif). Badges are gold and silver in color
Ribbon - "Labor's Non-Partisan League of New Jersey" ; pendants for ILGWU, AFL-CIO ; badge for AFL-CIO ; pins - ILGWU ; assorted gold & bronze in color

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous pins, push pins, money clip, tie tack, key chain

scopecontent.p: pins from ILGWU, AFL-CIO, GTB, LID, SindicatoTextil, N.U.T.G.W., K. of C. ; tie tacks not labelled, money clip from ILGWU

2 badges from "Miami Beach, Florida, June 1995", name badges with red/white/blue "Delegate" ribbons attached to pendant - "ILGWU, 42nd Convention " ; paper ribbon, red/white/blue - "Fight for the living, Pray for the dead" ; gold medal commemorating the "First Union Health Center"

did.unittitle: ILGWU - scrapbook articles in mostly Yiddish, a few English

scopecontent.p: Articles about ILGWU in English, but, majority are Yiddish.

did.unittitle: ILGWU - notes on strikes that took place

scopecontent.p: Notes taken about individual strikes that took place within branches of the ILGWU
Copies of request sheets from Leon Stein for books and articles at the New York Public Library
Two wooden plaques with issues of "Justice" laminated to the front. Issues, from Jan. 15 & April 1, 1964 (vol. XLVI, no.2 & XLVI, no.7)

did.unittitle: Plaques, one with a Justice article, and on from the United Jewish Appeal

scopecontent.p: Two wooden plaques one with an issue of Justice from April 15, 1964 (vol. XLVI, no. 8) and one is a Founder's Certificate from the United Jewish Appeal.
Black and white photograph of an Union label with lettering - "Int. Ladies Garment Workers Union, Union Made, ILGWU, AFL-CIO" ; "Made in the U.S.A."
Two pot holders made from material with the ILGWU label as part of the design.
Buttons of different shapes and designs, used in garment factories, and chalk/crayons used to mark the material for sewing/cutting.
Satin scarf, green, white, orange from the twenty- eighth convention of the ILGWU, May 1953 in Chicago.
Satin scarf, blue, yellow, white from the 'Golden Jubilee' of the ILGWU, 1900-1950.
White t-shirt with the ILGWU union label on the front, owned by Eva Rosenberg and donated by Bernice E. Kalaminsky.
Small amount of cloth with the ILGWU union label on it. Red, blue, green, yellow, flowered, polka dot, and checkered design.

did.unittitle: Bound arbitration hearing between American Cloak and Suit Manufacturers' Assoc. & ILGWU

scopecontent.p: Bound book with details of the arbitration hearing between American Cloak and Suit and ILGWU
Apron made from material for the ILGWU with the union label on it. Material is Red, blue, green, yellow, flowered, polka dot, and checkered in design.
Button up shirt made from material for the ILGWU with the union label on it. Material is Red, blue, green, yellow, flowered, polka dot, and checkered in design.

Paper hats - "Roll Back Imports" & "Save Garment Jobs" each with the ILGWU label on it. Blue cloth hat with the ILGWU label affixed to it.Two ILGWU sewing kits. Two ball point pens & a pencil advertising the ILGWU. Cloth union label, w/ILGWU symbol on it. Pin, sticker and magnet, memo book and sponge all advertising ILGWU. "Honorary Life Membership" card.
Gold plated watch with black band, writing on face "First Union Health Center, ILGWU"

did.unittitle: ILGWU - miscellaneous buttons and pendants, memorabilia

scopecontent.p: Buttons - one is a picture of three men (Louis Hyman, Bourockovitch, ?), one "ILGWU, AFL-CIO, Organized 1900". Pendants from medals, and a tool that appears to have been used in a textile factory to cut threads.

Two ribbons - "Cloak & Skirt Makers Union I.L.G.W.U., New York, Labor Day, 1912", "Skirt & Cloth Dressmakers Union L. 23". Pendant from 26th Convention (Cleveland, 1947) and sticker advertising ILGWU in Spanish.
Plastic shopping bag with handle, red/white/blue, with lettering "ILGWU" all over it, and "Look for the Union Label" on the front, along with the ILGWU label.

did.unittitle: ILGWU - Constitution and receipt book in Yiddish

scopecontent.p: Small bound book, Constitution and receipt book of Abraham Barroff (in Yiddish)

Badge - "Ex. Board", "Cloak Tailors Union, Local 9, We Mourn Our Loss, April 5, 1911" -- Black ribbon on gold badge with tarnished tassels. The Funeral Badge is kept in the Kheel Center safe. If you would like to see it, please ask to speak with the Director of the Kheel Center.
Key chain (6 the same) - "ILGWU, Union Made, Local 23-25" ; button - "The Union for me I.L.G.W.U."

pins - "Local 55, U.D.C., ILGWU" ; "24th Convention, ILGWU, 1940, New York" ; buttons - "No NAFTA, AFL-CIO" ; "SIAMO UNO NEL '91" ; "ILGWU, Made in U.S.A." ; "UNIDOS en 1994" ; "Support the Copper Strikers" ; "Union Contract" ; "On the move, ILGWU, Fortieth Convention, Hollywood, Florida, June 1989"
"I Support the Rank & File of Local 155, ILGWU" ; "ILGWU for Mayor Dinkins '93" ; "Local 155 I'm Registered to Vote" ; "Contract '88" ; "Local 155, ILGWU" ; "We are ONE in '91" ; "ILGWU for Dinkins"
Vented caps (hats), blue & white with lettering "ILGWU" and the ILGWU label, made in the U.S.A.
Gray, maroon, and blue neck ties, "Look For the Union Label"
White cup with lettering "Union Privilege, AFL-CIO

Two sharp knives shaped like machete, used for cutting cloth in factories.
One sharp knife shaped like a machete, used for cutting cloth in factories.
White nylon banner with the ILGWU Union Label printed on the front.
White nylon banner with navy lettering "Union Yes, International Ladies' Garment Workers' Union-AFL-CIO"
Yearly dues cards, held by Lois Hartel. -- All items in box 13 were part of a donation of items by Lois Hartel, items were split and put into appropriate collections.

Cloth, paper "Union Labels", some used in factories to be sewn into clothing, others used as patches. Some paper stickers with the 'Union Label' on them. -- All items in box 13 were part of a donation of items by Lois Hartel, items were split and put into appropriate collections.

Gold lighter, watch with union label as the face of the watch, jack knife -- All items in box 13 were part of a donation of items by Lois Hartel, items were split and put into appropriate collections.

"Boycott Volunteer, ILGWU" ; "United in 1994" [Eng., fre., spa.] ; "Clinton/Gore, It's Time for Change!" [union label] ; "Save Our Jobs, VETO the VETO, ILGWU" ; "Roll back IMPORTS" -- All items in box 13 were part of a donation of items by Lois Hartel, items were split and put into appropriate collections.

"Jane Wyman was right" ; "Clinton/Gore" ; two with union label on front ; "Liberty & Union, ILGWU" [with Statue of Liberty face] ; "ILGWU Price Watch Monitor" ; "I was there to roll back imports, April 10, 1985, Harrisburg, PA" ; "UNITI nel 1994" -- All items in box 13 were part of a donation of items by Lois Hartel, items were split and put into appropriate collections.

"SIAMO, UNO, Nel '91" ; "The Union for me I.L.G.W.U." ; "Contract '88" ; "ILGWU is family, American Family Celebration, Working for Change, May 14, 1988" ; others are duplicates. -- All items in box 13 were part of a donation of items by Lois Hartel, items were split and put into appropriate collections.

"The Union for me, I.L.G.W.U." ; "Support Your Local Garment" ; two - "Look for the ILGWU Union Label" ; some dupls. -- All items in box 13 were part of a donation of items by Lois Hartel, items were split and put into appropriate collections.
Buttons in several languages. -- All items in box 13 were part of a donation of items by Lois Hartel, items were split and put into appropriate collections.

Buttons, pins, badge, tie tack, cuff links. Pins are dupls. Badge - "Delegate" from the 39th Convention. Gold tie tack and matching cuff links with the ILGWU Union label on them. -- All items in box 13 were part of a donation of items by Lois Hartel, items were split and put into appropriate collections.

Buttons - "Tell Congress NO NAFTA" ; other items all duplicate things already in the collection -- All items in box 13 were part of a donation of items by Lois Hartel, items were split and put into appropriate collections.

scopecontent.p: Buttons - duplicates -- All items in box 13 were part of a donation of items by Lois Hartel, items were split and put into appropriate collections.

Most duplicate others in the collection, we have one unique that is triangle shaped, with pictures of an iron, scissors, sewing machine - "ILGWU, UIOVD", [Canadian Maple Leaf] -- All items in box 13 were part of a donation of items by Lois Hartel, items were split and put into appropriate collections.
Most have ILGWU label on them, others duplicate items in the collection. -- All items in box 13 were part of a donation of items by Lois Hartel, items were split and put into appropriate collections.

Sign made of paper over foam, light brown with dark brown lettering - "Int'l. Ladies' Garment Workers Union, A.F. of L.", "1000190" -- All items in box 13 were part of a donation of items by Lois Hartel, items were split and put into appropriate collections.

Pin shaped like the letters of ILGWU, gold with white stones, buttons - "Health Care For All", "Plastic, Metal, Trucking, Warehouse & Allied Worker's Union." -- All items in box 13 were part of a donation of items by Lois Hartel, items were split and put into appropriate collections.

did.unittitle: CLUW [Coalition of Labor Union Women] - Patches, book mark

scopecontent.p: Patch - "CLUW" ; book mark - "We didn't come here to swap recipes NOT THEN, 1974-NOT NOW, 1999!" -- All items in box 13 were part of a donation of items by Lois Hartel, items were split and put into appropriate collections.

One shoe bronzed as a 'souvenir' - "Lost by a scab who was later arrested, during the Dunkirk Lingerie Strike, 1969 in Dunkirk, NY." -- All items in box 13 were part of a donation of items by Lois Hartel, items were split and put into appropriate collections.
Various styles, sizes and shapes of 'Union Labels' used in clothing. All the labels have the ILGWU union bug on them
2 cloth aprons each with different material having the ILGWU union label on it. One apron is flowered and the other is a patchwork design.
3 cloth aprons all are white with blue Union Labels printed on them
3 satin scarves, all are red and white with blue Union Labels and "ILGWU" printed on them.
Button-up cotton shirt, flowered with the ILGWU Union Label printed on it.
Paddle fans (souvenirs) from the "41st ILGWU Convention, June 12, 1992, Fontainebleau Hotel, Miami Beach, Florida"
White shower cap with blue ILGWU Union label printed on it.
Pieces of cotton material, red, blue, yellow roses, with the ILGWU Union label printed in-between the flowers.
White plastic drawstring bag with blue 'ILGWU Union Labels' printed on it.
Two aprons are flowered plastic with blue 'ILGWU Union Labels' printed on them. One apron is white with the blue union label printed on it.
One window curtain, patchwork designed material with "ILGWU Union Label" printed in some of the squares of the design.
Two window curtains with tie backs, patchwork designed material with "ILGWU Union Label" printed in some of the squares of the design.

scopecontent.p: 9 ball point pens, 1 pencil and 2 markers - "Save a Job: Look for the Union Label" ; 4 ball point pens - "Look for the Union Label, You'll Know it's American-Made" ; 1 marker for "80th Anniversary, Northeast, Western Pennsylvania and Ohio Dept." ; 1 ball point pen for "Thirty-eighth Convention, Hollywood, Florida..." ; 1 ball point pen each for - "Atlantic Apparel Contr. Assn.", "Northeastern, Western Pa. and Ohio Department", "International Ladies' Garment Workers' Union..." and "Coalition of Labor Union Women"

scopecontent.p: White marble with metal seal of the "Coalition o f Labor Union Workers"

did.unittitle: ILGWU Mug and Unite House plastic cup

scopecontent.p: Plastic cup/glass with lettering "Unity House, Famed Pocono Resort Hotel" and plastic mug with lettering "If it's gonna be it's up to me a Union Woman" with the ILGWU union bug
Wrist watch with brown leatherette band, and the ILGWU union bug on the face of it.
Name tags for Joseph Lombardo, [UNITE, Local 155, Retiree] -- 2 red ribbons - [Delegate]
White labels with Red and Blue lettering - "UNITED in 1994" with a 'Union Label'
"Hand book on the Sanitary Label" - binding is weak, but bound booklet for use by Label Custodians

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous - adhesive union labels, booklet of ILGWU stamps, glass cleaning cloth

scopecontent.p: Glass cleaning cloth - "Symbol of decency, fair labor standards and the American way of life." ; Monthly per capita (1000 stamps) all "ILGWU" ; bumper stickers "Please look for this union label when you shop!" [purple with white lettering]
Purple stencils to use to print posters - "TONITE! George Meanyetc.

scopecontent.p: Signs - "Union Shop, Open from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Cleaners and Dye Workers" ; "Union Shop, this is to certify that this Laundry Establishment is in accordance." ; program - Northern California Labor Hall of FameJuly 27, 1990" ; "Certificate of Recognition - Presented to Jenny Matyas...."

Pocket calendars advertising ILGWU, for both 1974 and 1977, pocket - flip open mirror, with advertising for the ILGWU on the inside of cover, box made to hold a few aspirin with advertising for the ILGWU on the cover.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous - hat, pencil, rulers, key chains, sewing kit

did.unittitle: Local signs for ILGWU convention tables, and wooden block holders

scopecontent.p: Local signs for ILGWU Convention tables and wooden block holders. It was a tradition for Union members to bang the blocks on the Convention tables to signify their approval or disapproval.
